required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of the Addition of Uterosacral Ligament Plication to Pectopexy Operation on Anatomical and Subjective Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of the Addition of Uterosacral Ligament Plication to Pectopexy Operation on Anatomical and Subjective Symptoms in the Treatment of Apical Compartment Defects

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the investigators planned to measure the effectiveness of laparoscopic pectopexy in apical prolapse and whether the addition of sacrouterine ligaments plication to pectopexy increases the effectiveness of pectopexy operation. Investigators planned to measure patients' quality of life using the female sexual function scale test 3, 6 and 12 months after the surgery and to determine how the operation affects the quality of sexual life.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, the investigators planned to measure the effectiveness of laparoscopic pectopexy in apical prolapse and whether the addition of sacrouterine ligaments plication to pectopexy increases the effectiveness of pectopexy operation. Investigators planned to measure patients' quality of life using the female sexual function scale test 3, 6 and 12 months after the surgery and to determine how the operation affects the quality of sexual life.

primary_outcome.measure: questionnaire of lower urinary tract symptoms
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes in symptoms for each title at the preoperative day 1 and postoperative day 3 period
primary_outcome.description: the questionaire examines these titles by scoring from one to ten points: sudden feeling of ürination sudden feeling of urination with incontinence Frequent urination Difficulty of starting the urination Abnormal discharge of urine nocturia dyspareunia Stress urinary incontinence dysuria constipation

primary_outcome.measure: evaluation of sexual function with Women's Sexual Function Index
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes at the preoperative day 1 and postoperative day 40 period
primary_outcome.description: Women's Sexual Function Index is a questionnaire about sexual functions of the women. the index definex sexual functions with some questions and scorings.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage of apical compartment defect according to the Pelvic Organ Prolapse (POP-Q) classification
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes in the stage of apical compartment defect at the preoperative day 1 and postoperative day 3 period according to POP-Q clasification
primary_outcome.description: Stage of apical compartment defect according to the Pelvic Organ Prolapse (POP-Q) classification

secondary_outcome.measure: evaluation of sexual function with Women's Sexual Function Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: changes at 3,6 and 12. month after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Women's Sexual Function Index is a questionnaire about sexual functions of the women. the index definex sexual functions with some questions and scorings.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stage of apical compartment defect according to the Pelvic Organ Prolapse (POP-Q) classification
secondary_outcome.time_frame: changes at 3,6 and 12. month after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Stage of apical compartment defect according to the Pelvic Organ Prolapse (POP-Q) classification

secondary_outcome.measure: questionnaire of lower urinary tract symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: changes in symptoms for each title at 3,6 and 12. month after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: the questionaire examines these titles by scoring from one to ten points: sudden feeling of ürination sudden feeling of urination with incontinence Frequent urination Difficulty of starting the urination Abnormal discharge of urine nocturia dyspareunia Stress urinary incontinence dysuria constipation

arm_group.description: this group will only have pectopexy operation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pectopexy and uterosacral ligaments plication group
arm_group.description: this group will have pectopexy operation with bilateral uterosacral ligaments plication

intervention.description: Vaginal cuff or uterine cervix will be attached to iliopectineal ligament with polypropylene mesh on both sides.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pectopexy and uterosacral ligaments plication group

intervention.description: At least 2/3 of the sacrouterine ligaments will be shortened with helical sutures, starting from the cervix and so douglas will be partially obliterated.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pectopexy and uterosacral ligaments plication group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with stage II-IV apical compartment defect according to the POP-Q classification
Exclusion Criteria:
- having severe chronic disease that makes the operation dangerous
- patients under 25 and patients over 75 years old
